Questions.text: Regarding multiple sclerosis, it is correct to state:

choices.text: Outbreaks are more frequent during gestation
There may be mild lymphocytosis and / or slight increase in protein in the cerebrospinal fluid
The use of corticoids chronically reduces the frequency of outbreaks
Lhermitte's sign is worsening of symptoms with increase in body temperature

Questions.text: Patients with sickle cell anemia have frequent neurological complications. Check the alternative that is related to hemorrhagic stroke.
Guillain-Barr√© syndrome is the most frequent cause of:
A 45-year-old man has headache accompanied by bitemporal hemianopia. The probable cranial magnetic resonance imaging report is:

Patient, at the end of his workday, seeks medical attention looking very anxious and complaining of low back pain. During the examination, it is noted that the complaint of pain is disproportionate to the changes found, there is no clear definition of the movement that causes the pain, and the intensity of the pain decreases when the patient's attention is diverted. Does this picture match which etiology for low back pain?
